snippet: The moment a political campaign is assigned a Secret Service detail -- for Mitt Romney, it was Thursday -- tends to be a turning point, with a political downside as well as an upside.
abstract: The moment a political campaign is assigned a Secret Service detail -- for Mitt Romney, it was Thursday -- tends to be a turning point, with a political downside as well as an upside.
lead_paragraph: 10:21 a.m. | Updated LAS VEGAS - Most campaigns have a handful of pivotal moments - Barack Obama's race speech in 2008, John McCain's choice of running mate - but the appearance of a team of dark-suited, ramrod straight, hyperprofessional-looking Secret Service agents is an undeniable sign of success. For Mitt Romney, that happened on Thursday, and though it is still early, his campaign will need to manage the potential ramifications carefully.

headline.main: For Romney, the Perils of Protection
